Where politics meets the press

                Donald Trump was scheduled to appear on Jimmy Kimmel's show Tuesday night after rapper Jay Z. (AP)

            By 
Hadas Gold

10/20/15 11:45 AM EDT
Donald Trump has canceled a planned appearance on "Jimmy Kimmel Live," the host said on Howard Stern's satellite radio show Tuesday.
Trump was scheduled to appear on Tuesday night's show after rapper Jay Z. Kimmel, who is broadcasting his late night show out of Brooklyn this week, told Stern that Trump canceled on them late Monday night.
"Due to a political obligation, Mr. Trump is rescheduling his appearance and looks forward to being on the show in the next few weeks," a Trump spokeswoman told CNN.
On Stern's show on Tuesday, Kimmel said he wasn't sure what happened, but that they may move comedian Tracy Morgan to take his place. Morgan originally was scheduled to appear on the show later this week.
Kimmel told CNN in an earlier interview on Monday that Trump's appearance was not going to be a traditional interview.
"I'm not interviewing him ... It will be in studio, it'll be live, and it'll all make perfect sense when you see it," Kimmel said.
It's the second time in a month that a politician has canceled on a late-night host. Earlier this month, House Speaker John Boehner canceled a last-minute appearance on Jimmy Fallon's "The Tonight Show" after Rep. Kevin McCarthy abruptly pulled out of the race for House speaker.
Hadas Gold is a reporter at Politico.
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
description: Donald Trump was scheduled to appear on Tuesday night's show after rapper Jay Z.
title: Donald Trump cancels on Jimmy Kimmel
